article_title: Growth Across Businesses Lifts UnitedHealth's 2015 Results

article_metadata.author: Great Speculations

og.description: The company improved its top line, with consolidated revenues of $157 billion compared to $130 billion a year ago. Operating earnings also jumped by over 7% year-over-year to over $11 billion. This was despite a decline in operating margins as the company experienced losses at individual health insurance exchanges as well as the loss of a Medicaid contract, although growth in the pharmacy care business did ease some of that decline. The company’s medical care ratio (expenses to premiums) of 81.7% in 2015 was also affected by the individual insurance products on health insurance exchanges.
